content: Yes, there have been instances where influencers have been criticized or called out for promoting products that are harmful or unethical. Such instances occur when influencers prioritize monetary benefits over the well-being of their followers. To avoid promoting such products, influencers should conduct due diligence when partnering with brands and carefully evaluate whether the products align with their values and whether they are promoting something that is safe and ethical. Additionally, it is essential to be transparent with their audience about promoting a good, whether through disclosure of payments or compensation or a clear delineation between their personal and promotional content. By being transparent and authentic, influencers can build trust with their followers and avoid being associated with damaging or unethical products.
